pages.md:
# The Command Dials

Rotate or press the command dials to:

| Front command dial | Rear command dial |
|--------------------|-------------------|
| !Front Command Dial | !Rear Command Dial |

## Rotate

- **Front Command Dial:**
  - Select menu tabs or page through menus
  - Adjust aperture¹,²
  - View other pictures during playback

- **Rear Command Dial:**
  - Highlight menu items
  - Choose the desired combination of shutter speed and aperture (program shift)
  - Choose a shutter speed¹,⁴
  - Adjust exposure compensation by rotating the dial while pressing the function button to which **EXPO. COMP.** is assigned¹
  - Adjust settings in the quick menu
  - Choose the size of the focus frame
  - Zoom in or out in full frame playback
  - Zoom in or out in multi-frame playback

## Press

- **Front Command Dial:**
  - Switch between aperture and ISO sensitivity²
  - Press and hold to choose the option selected for !Button/Dial Setting **BUTTON/DIAL SETTING > COMMAND DIAL SETTING** in the !Setup Menu (setup) menu

- **Rear Command Dial:**
  - Zoom in on the active focus point³
  - Press and hold to choose the manual focus mode focus display³
  - Zoom in on the active focus point during playback

----

¹ Can be changed using !Button/Dial Setting **BUTTON/DIAL SETTING > COMMAND DIAL SETTING**.

² If the lens is equipped with an aperture ring with an “A” or “C” position, the aperture ring must be in the A or C position.

³ Available only if **FOCUS CHECK** is assigned to a function button.

⁴ Only if a value other than auto is selected for shutter speed.

> 💡 **Note:**  
> The rotation direction for the command dials can be selected using !Button/Dial Setting **BUTTON/DIAL SETTING > COMMAND DIAL DIRECTION**.
